info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 01 at 12:38PM EDT until June 01 at 1:15PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 PM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN WAYNE COUNTY... At 1238 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Greenfield Village to near Dearborn to near Grosse Ile, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Downtown Detroit around 1245 PM EDT. Belle Isle around 1250 PM EDT. Grosse Pointe around 100 PM EDT. St. Clair Shores around 105 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Melvindale, Roseville, Harper Woods, Pleasant Ridge, Grosse Pointe Shores, Ecorse, Center Line, Grosse Pointe Woods, Lincoln Park and Grosse Pointe Park. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
